main event: A control tower operator at Geiger Field in Spokane, Washington observed a formation of 10 white lights moving from northeast to southwest in 10 seconds, followed by a second flight of 3 lights following the same course as the first.
interesting points: The lights were described as a 'jumbled formation' moving at a high speed.
The lights were observed visually from the control tower at Geiger Field.
The weather was clear with 25 miles visibility and winds from the west-southwest at 39 knots.
No balloons or aircraft were noted in the area at the time of the sighting.
The sighting lasted for approximately 10 seconds.
